alert.note: Alert for Edwards; Gallatin; Wabash; White (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 30 at 10:37AM CDT until April 09 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Illinois... Wabash River from Covington down to Mount Carmel. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Wabash River at Montezuma. .Widespread lowland flooding continues along the Wabash River from Covington to all points downstream. Moderate flooding is forecast to start at Mount Carmel on Friday...and continue through next Tuesday. The slow crest on the Wabash River will continue along the Crawford...Sullivan County line through Friday. Minor flooding will likely last through late this week at Covington to Terre Haute...through early next week at Hutsonville to Vincennes...and through late next week at Mount Carmel. Rain going into this weekend may extend flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY, APRIL 09... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Mount Carmel. * WHEN...Until Sunday, April 09. * IMPACTS...At 25.5 feet, Extensive lowland flooding in progress. Much of the flood plain activity is affected by high water. Numerous local river roads flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Thursday /10:45 AM EDT Thursday/ the stage was 24.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM CDT Thursday /10:45 AM EDT Thursday/ was 24.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.6 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday, April 08. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
